title: Your pictures on the theme of 'back in time'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

title: Black fungus: Is diabetes behind India's high number of cases?
description: India has seen rising cases of the serious fungal infection, mostly in Covid patients.

title: Three police killings in the US: Is there a better way?
description: We asked experts to walk us through three different instances of police shootings in the US.

title: Letter from Africa: How Zimbabwe is still haunted by Robert Mugabe
description: Long-serving ruler Robert Mugabe, who died in 2019, seems to be causing trouble from beyond the grave.

title: Viewpoint: Why Sicilians still turn to Mafia to settle scores
description: Italy has reduced the Sicilian Mafia's violence, but it still wields power in crime and business.

title: Freddie Figgers: The millionaire tech inventor who was 'thrown away' as a baby
description: Entrepreneur Freddie Figgers says life has taught him that the important thing is people, not profits.

title: Canada's residential schools: 'There's no reconciliation without truth'
description: Geraldine Lee Shingoose was sent to a Canadian residential school as a child. Here's her story.

title: Inside a Muslim ballet school for girls
description: A ballet academy is trying to make dance accessible to Muslim girls by moving to poetry instead of music.

title: 'I survived breast cancer and then Covid'
description: Katy Meldrum says she struggled to leave the house following her ordeal.

title: Police riot shields upcycled into greenhouses
description: About 200 shields have now been donated to schools and organisations in the form of greenhouses.

title: St Helens cruise past York to win Women's Challenge Cup for first time
description: St Helens run in seven tries at Leigh Sports Village to beat York City Knights and win the Women's Challenge Cup.

title: Svitolina out as seed exodus continues at French Open
description: Elina Svitolina becomes the seventh women's top-10 seed to exit the French Open's opening week as she falls to Barbora Krejcikova.

title: G7: Rich nations back deal to tax multinationals
description: G7 finance ministers have agreed to work together to create a "level playing field" on global taxation.

title: Covid: People in hospital with Indian variant not increasing significantly - NHS boss
description: Chris Hopson says vaccines seem to have "broken the chain" between infection and serious illness.

title: Covid in Scotland: Restriction levels ease for millions of Scots
description: In Glasgow people are allowed to meet in each other's homes for the first time in nine months.

title: US gun laws: Judge overturns California assault weapons ban
description: The judge ruled that the law undermined constitutional gun ownership rights.

title: Wallace and Gromit: Comedy duo set for Preston statue
description: The much-loved animated characters will be cast in bronze in their creator's birthplace of Preston.

title: Euro 2020: Wales await Red Wall's emotional return for Albania friendly
description: Wales' fans, known as the Red Wall, will return for the first time since 2019 for Saturday's friendly with Albania.

title: Microsoft says error caused 'Tank Man' Bing censorship
description: Microsoft's Bing search engine showed no image results for the famous Tiananmen Square protester.

title: The Papers: 'Jabs blitz' as infections 'surge'
description: Saturday's papers react to a rise in the number of people infected with Covid in the UK.

title: FBI sought info on who read USA Today news article for case
description: The USA Today newspaper is resisting an FBI demand to hand over data on readers of its story.

title: EuroMillions: Jackpot of more than £111m won by UK ticket holder
description: Players are being asked to check to see if they have won the prize - the ninth biggest in lottery history.
